content:
I was trying to run cargo install cargo-binutils and in the middle of running it, my laptop powered down b/c of low battery.

Now when I try to run most cargo commands, I get some version of the following error:

$ cargo install cargo-binutils
    Updating crates.io index
error: failed to fetch `https://github.com/rust-lang/crates.io-index`

Caused by:
  object not found - no match for id (21d81e29b31b1b507e6a70ff0c27cd67ce52aa25); class=Odb (9); code=NotFound (-3)

I assume I just need to delete or reset something, but what it is is not clear. Any tips on how to reset my crates.io index? Thanks!
This topic was moved here from #general > corrupted crates.io index by simulacrum

ok, I deleted ~/.cargo/registry and everything started working again.

I'd still be curious to know where/what the actual problem might have been. I grepped for that hash and couldn't find it anywhere.
